Text: Blasted guns...!
Perhaps we should place the soldiers in front so...
And what, use them as human shields?!
But without magic, we have no hope...!

More concerning is how they sealed the underground
passages. If they were able to cut off all connection
with the outside that precisely...
They must have a collaborator inside the Academy...
So Zenon wasn't the last of them?!

Having received the implements she needed from Cid,
Sherry gets to work calibrating the artifact.
Cid plops down on the sofa and starts reading a book.

Time passes quietly. The sunlight shining through the
windows gradually takes on a crimson hue.

Cid occasionally gets up, making trips to the
restroom.

Seeing his frequent visits to the toilet, Sherry gives
Cid some stomach medicine, which he accepts with a
grimace.

And then, right as the sun sets completely,
Sherry finishes her task.
...All done!
Nice work.

Yes, I was able to pull it off. Now we can curb the
effects of the Eye of Avarice blocking our magic.

(Alright, the sun is down, and things are looking
good.)
So about those secret passages...
Oh, right. Well, according to Foster Father...

Sherry pushes a book on one of the shelves along the
wall.

The bookcase slides to the side, revealing a stairway
leading underground.
Wow.
(I LOVE stuff like this...!)

There are several hidden escape routes throughout the
Academy. But this particular one hasn't seen use in
quite some time.
A hint of sadness appears in Sherry's eyes.

The dust on the stairs is undisturbed... There are no
footprints. I was hoping Foster Father had made it to
safety through here.

Memories of walking this passageway with him stir in
Sherry's mind. She had pestered him to put down his
work and play with her. It was a cherished experience
she will never forget.

Sherry has no memories of her true father, who died
soon after she was born, and can only faintly recall
her mother, who was murdered in the night during a
robbery when Sherry was 9 years old.

She recalls the black figure she saw through the
crack of the closet door that night vividly.
What a foolish thing to do...
N-No, don't...
Eeeeeek...!
*gasp*
Mother?

Her mother's scream and that bloodcurdling chuckle
still torment her dreams to this day.

Sherry was unable to speak for several years after
the incident. She blocked out everything around her
and immersed herself in the study of her mother's
artifacts as if trying to follow in her footsteps.
...We lost someone very precious.

Your mother was a very gifted researcher...but even
more so, a dear friend.
...If you would like, you may come live with me.

Foster Father showed me all the love he would to his
true family. He even helped me continue my mother's
unfinished studies...

Thanks to this, Sherry eventually recovered her
powers of speech.

Her memories of family are almost exclusively with
her foster father.

He had been there for her every step of the way.
And now the day has come when she can return
the favor.
Now, it's my turn...
Well, I hope your foster father's safe.
Cid... Thank you, truly.
I only helped out a little.

There's nothing more I can do, so now it's up to you
to save the world.
I'll do my best.
Sherry smiles and descends the steps.
